item.title: 网络中断导致业务中断，从伦敦到新加坡的交易商陷入困境
item.description: 从伦敦到新加坡的石油、天然气、电力、股票、货币和债券交易商周五都在努力运作，因为全球网络故障阻碍了他们的业务，公司、银行和交易消息人士说。【原文：Traders in oil, gas, power, stocks, currencies and bonds from London to Singapore struggled to operate on Friday as a global cyber outage hampered operations, companies, banks and trading sources said.】

item.title: 澳大利亚法院对违反信用卡规则的美国运通罚款 530 万美元
item.description: 澳大利亚企业监管机构周五表示，澳大利亚联邦法院对美国运通（AmEx）的一家地方机构处以 800 万澳元（536 万美元）的罚款，原因是其两张联名信用卡违反了设计和分销规则。【原文：The Federal Court of Australia fined a local unit of American Express (AmEx) A$8 million ($5.36 million) for breaching design and distribution rules for two of its co-branded credit cards, the Australian corporate regulator said on Friday.】

item.title: 航空旅行受全球网络故障影响
item.description: 由于机场和航空公司陷入大规模的 IT 故障，世界各地的飞机乘客面临延误、取消和办理登机手续的问题，从银行到媒体公司等各行各业也受到影响。【原文：Air passengers around the world faced delays, cancellations and problems checking in as airports and airlines were caught up in a massive IT outage that also affected industries ranging from banks to media companies.】

item.title: 空中客车公司 A321XLR 喷气式客机获得欧洲认证
item.description: 空中客车公司发言人周五表示，该公司单通道喷气机家族的最新成员--远程 A321XLR 已获得欧洲认证。【原文：Airbus has won European certification for the latest addition to its single-aisle family of jets, the long-distance A321XLR, a spokesperson said on Friday.】

item.title: 全球网络瘫痪导致航班停飞，媒体、金融和电信遭受重创
item.description: 美国主要航空公司周五以通信问题为由下令停飞，而全球其他航空公司、媒体公司、银行和电信公司也报告称系统故障正在干扰他们的运营。【原文：Major U.S. airlines ordered ground stops on Friday citing communications issues, while other carriers, media companies, banks and telecoms firms around the world also reported system outages were disrupting their operations.】

item.title: 官员称泰国计划制定新的金融商业法以吸引资金
item.description: 泰国财政部副部长周五表示，泰国正计划出台一部新的金融商业法，以吸引外国资金并促进该行业的投资。【原文：Thailand is planning to introduce a new financial business law to attract foreign funds and facilitate investment in the sector, a deputy finance minister said on Friday.】

item.title: 大宗商品价格下跌拖累欧洲股市下挫
item.description: 受大宗商品价格下降和全球科技股溃败的影响，欧洲股市周五下跌，并将出现单周跌幅，同时投资者还在评估更多最新财报。【原文：European shares fell on Friday and were set for weekly losses, hurt by lower commodity prices and as a rout in global technology shares extended, while investors assessed more earnings updates.】

item.title: 即使经济放缓，中国仍可能维持贷款利率：路透社民意调查
item.description: 路透社的一项民意调查显示，中国预计将在周一维持基准贷款利率不变，而在第二季度经济数据弱于预期之后，更多的市场参与者预计中国将进一步放松银根以刺激经济。【原文：China is expected to leave benchmark lending rates unchanged on Monday, while more market participants project further monetary easing to aid the economy following weaker-than-expected second-quarter economic data, a Reuters poll showed.】

item.title: 通胀重回目标，欧洲央行决策者支持更多降息措施
item.description: 两位欧洲中央银行（ECB）决策者周五支持进一步降息，对明年通胀率将达到欧洲中央银行的目标表示了更大的信心。【原文：Two European Central Bank policymakers on Friday backed further interest rate cuts, expressing greater confidence that inflation was heading to the ECB's goal next year.】

item.title: LSEG 的 Workspace 平台遭遇大面积故障
item.description: LSEG 集团的 Workspace 新闻和数据平台周五发生故障，影响了全球用户的访问。【原文：LSEG Group's Workspace news and data platform suffered an outage on Friday that affected user access worldwide.】

item.title: 英国批准国民福利大厦与维珍钱庄 37.5 亿美元的交易
item.description: 英国竞争监管机构周五表示，已批准全美房屋建筑协会（Nationwide Building Society）拟以 29 亿英镑（37.5 亿美元）全现金收购英国维珍钱庄（Virgin Money UK）的交易。【原文：Britain's competition regulator said on Friday it has cleared Nationwide Building Society's proposed 2.9-billion-pound ($3.75 billion) all-cash deal to buy Virgin Money UK .】

item.title: 美国航空公司因通信问题发布地面停飞，FAA 状态页面显示
item.description: 据美国联邦航空管理局的状态页面显示，由于通信问题，美国大型航空公司美国航空周五早些时候发布了所有航班停飞的消息。【原文：Major U.S. carrier American Airlines issued a ground stop for all its flights early on Friday due to a communication issue, according to the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration's status page.】

item.title: 全球流动的百万富翁威胁因税收问题抛弃英国
item.description: 对于超级富豪企业家巴西姆-海达尔（Bassim Haidar）来说，住在伦敦已经成为一种昂贵的放纵，他再也无法为之辩解。【原文：For ultra-wealthy entrepreneur Bassim Haidar, living in London has become an expensive indulgence he can no longer justify.】

item.title: 英国国家统计局：英国 6 月零售额降幅超预期
item.description: 英国国家统计局（Office for National Statistics）周五表示，英国 6 月份零售销售量的降幅超出预期，在 5 月份大幅增长 2.9% 之后又下降了 1.2%。【原文：British retail sales volumes fell by more than expected in June, dropping by 1.2% after a 2.9% jump in May, the Office for National Statistics said on Friday.】

item.title: 伊莱克斯受美国市场回暖提振，但货运成本增加
item.description: 由于北美业务出现了期待已久的回暖迹象，伊莱克斯在第二季度实现了远高于预期的利润，这使得这家家电制造商的股价在周五短暂大幅走高。【原文：Electrolux swung to a much larger than expected profit in the second quarter amid signs of a long-awaited pick up in its North American business, briefly sending the appliances maker's shares sharply higher on Friday.】

item.title: 贸易紧张局势加剧，中国风力涡轮机制造商进军欧洲
item.description: 本月，中国风力涡轮机制造商在德国获得了第一份订单，为其在欧洲市场的发展注入了动力，同时也加剧了欧盟业界对其面临生存威胁的担忧。【原文：Chinese wind turbine-makers this month clinched their first order in Germany, as they build momentum in the European market and add to concern in the EU industry that it faces an existential threat.】

item.title: 国防订单激增，萨博利润超预期
item.description: 瑞典防务设备制造商萨博（Saab）公布的季度营业利润增幅略高于预期，并维持其对今年销售和利润激增的展望，因为各国都在竞相扩充军队。【原文：Swedish defence equipment maker Saab reported a marginally bigger-than-expected rise in quarterly operating earnings and maintained its outlook for surging sales and earnings this year as countries race to scale up militaries.】

item.title: 国际能源署（IEA）称，不断增长的制冷需求将使煤炭发电厂今年继续运行
item.description: 国际能源机构（IEA）周五在一份报告中称，随着气温升高，空调需求不断增加，今年全球电力需求将以近20年来的最快速度增长。【原文：Global electricity demand is set to grow at its fastest pace in nearly 20 years this year, spurred by increasing demand for air conditioning as temperatures rise, the International Energy Agency (IEA) said in a report on Friday.】

item.title: 日本首都面临更大的通胀压力
item.description: 路透社周五对 17 位经济学家进行的调查显示，东京地区 7 月份的核心消费通胀率可能比上月略有加快，这凸显了生活成本持续上升的压力。【原文：Tokyo-area's core consumer inflation likely accelerated slightly in July compared with the previous month, a Reuters poll of 17 economists showed on Friday, highlighting persistent upward pressure on the cost of living.】

item.title: 消费品制造商受欧美销售疲软拖累
item.description: 尼尔森（Nielsen）的数据显示，包括雀巢（Nestle）、卡夫亨氏（Kraft Heinz）和利洁时（Reckitt）在内的消费品巨头可能会报告欧洲和美国第二季度销售增长乏力，因为消费者会选择那些在减缓价格上涨方面表现较好的品牌。【原文：Consumer goods giants including Nestle, Kraft Heinz and Reckitt are likely to report weak second-quarter sales growth from Europe and the United States, as consumers opt for brands that have been better at slowing price hikes, Nielsen data shows.】

item.title: 受中国市场影响，迅达第二季度订单量下滑
item.description: 瑞士电梯和自动扶梯制造商迅达（Schindler）周五公布，第二季度订单额为29.8亿瑞士法郎（约合33.5亿美元），按当地货币计算比去年同期下降0.4%，原因是中国新安装量减少。【原文：Swiss lift and escalator maker Schindler reported a second-quarter order intake of 2.98 billion Swiss francs ($3.35 billion) on Friday, down 0.4% from a year earlier in local currencies, as lower new installations in China weigh.】

item.title: 早间竞价市场将面临颠簸
item.description: Rae Wee 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Rae Wee】

item.title: 超过四分之三的经济学家认为日本央行将放弃 7 月加息
item.description: 路透社的一项民意调查显示，超过四分之三的经济学家表示，日本央行将在 7 月底的政策制定会议上跳过加息，因为它希望提振不温不火的经济增长。【原文：The Bank of Japan will skip raising interest rates at its policy-setting meeting at the end of July as it looks to boost tepid economic growth, more than three-quarters of economists said in a Reuters poll.】

item.title: 中国官员预期经济政策将崎岖不平
item.description: 中国官员周五承认，本周中国共产党重要会议结束时再次强调的一系列经济目标包含 "许多复杂的矛盾"，这表明未来政策实施的道路将崎岖不平。【原文：Chinese officials acknowledged on Friday the sweeping list of economic goals re-emphasised at the end of a key Communist Party meeting this week contained "many complex contradictions," pointing to a bumpy road ahead for policy implementation.】

item.title: 微软解决了导致美国部分航空公司停飞的云故障问题
item.description: 微软公司周五早些时候表示，美国中部地区的云服务故障已经解决，此前该故障曾导致多架航班停飞和取消。【原文：Microsoft said early on Friday that its cloud services outage in the Central U.S. region was resolved after it led to the grounding and cancellation of several flights.】

item.title: 中共官员称中国经济复苏不够强劲
item.description: 中国共产党负责财经事务的高级官员周五表示，中国的经济复苏还不够强劲，政府需要更有效地实施宏观政策。【原文：China's economic recovery is not strong enough and the government needs to implement macro policies more effectively, said the senior Communist Party official for financial and economic affairs on Friday.】

item.title: 日元疲软推动旅游业蓬勃发展，日本 6 月游客人数达到创纪录的 314 万
item.description: 周五的官方数据显示，由于日元疲软推动了旅游业的繁荣，日本 6 月份的月度游客人数创下了新纪录，而旅游业正成为日本经济的主要驱动力。【原文：Japan set a fresh record for monthly visitors in June, official data showed on Friday, as the weak yen fuelled a tourism boom that is becoming a key driver for the economy.】

item.title: 中国开始对美国丙酸产品征收反倾销税
item.description: 中国商务部周五表示，将从 7 月 21 日起对原产于美国的丙酸产品实施为期五年的反倾销税。【原文：China's Ministry of Commerce said on Friday it will implement anti-dumping duties on propionic acid products originating from the United States for five years from July 21.】

item.title: 日本下调经济增长预期，专家小组成员担心日元疲软带来的痛苦
item.description: 日本政府周五下调了今年的经济增长预期，原因是日元疲软导致进口成本上涨，从而打击了消费，凸显了经济复苏的脆弱性。【原文：Japan's government cut this year's growth forecast on Friday as consumption took a hit from rising import costs due to a weak yen, highlighting the fragile nature of the economic recovery.】

item.title: 亚洲股市因科技股下跌蔓延和全球不确定性而下跌
item.description: 由于地缘政治格局和主要经济体的不确定性，即使在全球宽松利率周期开始之际，投资者仍面临更多不利因素，本周亚洲股市将以低迷收尾。【原文：Asian shares are set to end the week on a sour note, as uncertainty across the geopolitical landscape and in major economies added to headwinds for investors even as the global rate easing cycle gets under way.】
